titles.title: Military Spouse Entrepreneur Reimbursement Act
Military Spouse Entrepreneur Reimbursement Act

To amend title 37, United States Code, to expand business costs, incurred by the spouse of a member of the uniformed services because of a permanent change of station or assignment for such member, eligible for reimbursement by the Secretary concerned.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary:
Military Spouse Entrepreneur Reimbursement Act
This bill authorizes the military department concerned to reimburse certain business costs (e.g., equipment removal or relocation) incurred by the spouse of a member of the Armed Forces when the member is reassigned or moved to a new duty station.
